conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows.
Shadow A is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow B is cast directly behind the nail.
Shadow C is cast to the left of the roll of paper.
Shadow D is cast to the right of the ring.
Shadows will be cast in the opposite direction of the new light source when it moves to the back right.
Shadow A will move to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow B will move to the front and to the left.
Shadow C will move to the right.
Shadow D will move to the left and backward.
Shadows will shift to the left and backward, and may become longer and more spread out.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left and backward.
